page.title: 08TOURISM
page.content: This area attracts many tourists and visitors.The Moel Famau Country Park is popular for picnics and walking.Offa's Dyke Long Distance Path runs along the ridge of the Clwydian Hills and from it one can see excellent views as far away as Snowdonia. Many cyclists travel along the back roads.They come from Liverpool and other areas.People with interests in birdwatching and other wild life find plenty here to interest them. There are also numerous places of historical importance,such as the Moel y Gaer Iron Age hillfort which are of interest to visitors.Moel y Gaer is one of several Iron Age forts to be found on the Clwydian Hills.
